insight: The Ma anomaly gets a topological explanation: under the axis-fixing involution in S4, four note-pairs are "vertex-divergent" (V-type orbits) while exactly one pair is "edge-inverted" (E-type, an oriented-edge flip). That single E-type pair naturally demands a different naming logic (shuddh/tivra rather than komal/shuddh), matching Ma's unique status among the variable swaras.
